With her own strength and determination she has been able to help others by telling her story as part of a DV campaign "Loves me, Loves me not" Dubbo were given the opportunity to have Angela be the guest speaker at 2 of our White Ribbon Events in Dubbo, giving the community awareness in regards to DV.  Sue and Nick did not hesitate in offering their accommodation for such a great cause.  Angela and her parents were appreciative of being able to stay in such a beautiful home which was fully wheel chair friendly.  The home was well equipped with everything you could ask for and more. If you’re reading this, you’ve already been drawn to the good taste and nice features.  The house really is quality and the garden really is that well kept.  Nice touches like power cubes with USB sockets in each bedroom, beautiful bedding and window dressings, fly screens on every window, ceiling fans in 2 of the bedrooms, air conditioning, gas heating...a north facing deck with a shade cloth and comfortable furniture.  We had perfect autumnal weather but this place would work well in summer or winter too.  Everything is ergonomic, works well and is soft on the eye.  
Breakfast things, treats and a ‘mini bar’ type option are welcome to the weary traveller.  
We arrived by train and caught the bus to the zoo (572a from the next corner - no bus stop - just hail and ride).  We left the Dubbo Bus Lines timetables in the house.  The services are not very frequent but can work with planning.   We also used Dubbo Taxis who were prompt and friendly.  There are servos and take aways within 5 mins walk of the house.  The CBD and train station are about a 20 min walk away. 
We are an older couple travelling with our 12yr old goddaughter.   Sue and Nick’s place ticked all the boxes for all of us.  Thank you!
